docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The West German Government is about to push through legislation that will drastically reduce national health insurance payments for many drugs, a move strongly opposed by pharmaceutical companies.

headline.main: Germany Set To Cap Costs Of Medication

docs.snippet: LEAD: The West German Government is about to push through legislation that will drastically reduce national health insurance payments for many drugs, a move strongly opposed by pharmaceutical companies.

byline.original: By MICHAEL FARR, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: On the outskirts of this ocher and green city - the hues of the sand and the flat-roofed buildings match, trees lend contrasts - lies a graveyard of buses. The corroded hulks of more than 600 yellow Mercedes buses, their engines and seats ripped out, stand side by side, a sad metaphor of Khartoum's decay.

headline.main: Khartoum Journal; At the End of the Road Is the Graveyard of Hope

docs.snippet: LEAD: On the outskirts of this ocher and green city - the hues of the sand and the flat-roofed buildings match, trees lend contrasts - lies a graveyard of buses. The corroded hulks of more than 600 yellow Mercedes buses, their engines and seats...

byline.original: By JANE PERLEZ, Special to the New York Times
